cbir

Class RelevanceFeedbackTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • cbir.RelevanceFeedbackTest

  • public class RelevanceFeedbackTest
extends java.lang.Object
    Performs a query with Relevance Feedback.
    Author:
    Chris Wendler, Matej Stanic

    • Field Summary

      static DescriptorType[] indexingFor

      The metric that is used for the ranking.
      static Utility.Normalization normalization
      The normalization that is used on the descriptor of interest, this is important for the merged descriptor!
      static java.lang.String outputfile
      The name of the output-file can be specified here.
      static int queryAmount
      For this test you can change the amount of random queries that is performed here, if you want to use your own query images you have to rewrite the main method.
      static java.lang.String resultFolder
      The folder where the resulting html file will be stored.
      static RelevanceFeedback rf
      The relevance feedback method that should be used has to be specified here.
      static DescriptorType type
      The descriptor-type of interest for the ranking.
      static boolean useIndexing
      Indicates whether you want to use indexing or not.
      static java.io.File xml_path
      The path of the xml file containing the descriptors for your database.

        public static DescriptorType[] indexingFor

    • Method Detail

      • relevanceFeedbackDemo

        public static void relevanceFeedbackDemo(RelevanceFeedback rf,
                         RetrieverDistanceBased retriever,
                         ImageContainer query,
                         DescriptorType type,
                         Metric metric,
                         java.util.List<ImageContainer> result)
        This is a demo implementation of a relevance feedback iteration. usage: * for each rf iteration you need to specify the indices of the relevant and irrelevant images. There are several commands that the demo user interface accepts: "others": this command has to be entered when the program asks for irrelevant images, by entering "others" all images that are not marked as relevant are considered as irrelevant. "all": this command has to be entered when the program asks for relevant images. This means that all images are considered as positive. "assist": this command has to be entered when the program asks for relevant images, after assist you have to specify the file name of the file that contains the already marked images. IMPORTANT: you still have to mark the positive images in the same line. "quit": this command has to be entered when the program asks for relevant images, and causes the rf demo to stop, so the next query can be performed. After stop you can specify a filename where the marked images should be saved, this is needed when you want to use the assistant function in the future.
        Parameters:
        rf - the relevance feedback method that is used.
        retriever - the retriever that is used.
        query - the query image for which rf is performed.
        type - the descriptor-type of interest.
        metric - the metric that is used to calculate the ranking.
        result - the result list of the previous iteration.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        1) define metric 2) initialize list of images (database) & EHD descriptor from XML file 3) get Color Histogram from Fire file 4)
